bioghist.p: The Evening School was one of the original departments established at the Drexel Institute during the first year of classes in 1892. It offered purely technical, non-degree courses of study until 1950, when the Evening College earned accreditation to grant the B.S. degree. The Evening College's name was changed to University College in 1993, and it was briefly discontinued in 1993, when its programs were transferred to the College of Arts and Sciences. The Evening College was re-established in 1997 as the College of Evening and Professional Studies.

scopecontent.p: The evening college collection is currently increasing, as a large volume of records are being transferred to the archives from the college offices. Currently, meeting minutes of the faculty heads, student and faculty guides, and annual reports of the college comprise the majority of the collection. There is also an assortment of unprocessed information relating to the Drexel Student's Wives club and fraternal organizations. There is also extensive information on academic programs and curricula.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
